snippet: Some analysts said the Chrysler and Fiat merger could become a model for trans-Atlantic cooperation in the auto industry.
abstract: Analysts say the Chrysler and Fiat merger could become a model for trans-Atlantic cooperation in the auto industry, as companies are starting to produce new vehicles that combine talents of both companies; firms sold about 4.2 million vehicles in 2011, and hope to sell 6 million by 2014.
lead_paragraph: Some analysts said the Chrysler and Fiat merger could become a model for trans-Atlantic cooperation in the auto industry.

headline.seo: Chrysler and Fiat Merger Shows Fruits of Teamwork
headline.main: A Merger Once Scoffed At Bears Fruit in Detroit
headline.print_headline: A Merger Once Scoffed At Bears Fruit in Detroit
